events.description: A national election for the lower house of the Japanese parliament scheduled for the upcoming weekend.
Speculation in late January regarding a joint effort to stabilize the currency.

facts.fact_text: The Japanese yen depreciated past 156 per dollar on Wednesday.

evidences.evidence_text: The Japanese yen depreciated past 156 per dollar on Wednesday, sliding for the fourth straight session to a near two-week low

facts.fact_text: The yen rallied as much as 4.5% in late January.

evidences.evidence_text: The yen had rallied as much as 4.5% in late January on speculation of a US-Japan joint currency intervention

facts.fact_text: Sanae Takaichi stated that a weak yen could benefit export industries.

evidences.evidence_text: Takaichi also said over the weekend that a weak yen could be an opportunity for export industries

claims.claim_text: The ruling LDP is expected to gain more seats in the national election.
claims.author: Market Analysts/Article

evidences.evidence_text: Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi’s ruling LDP is expected to gain more seats in the national election

claims.claim_text: Expansionary fiscal policies are raising concerns about Japan's fiscal outlook.

evidences.evidence_text: raising concerns about Japan’s fiscal outlook on fears of debt-funded spending.

claims.claim_text: Takaichi's remarks were intended to promote an economy resilient to currency swings.
claims.author: Sanae Takaichi

evidences.evidence_text: clarifying that her remarks were intended to promote an economy resilient to currency swings.

evidence.evidence_text: sliding for the fourth straight session to a near two-week low ahead of this weekend’s snap lower house election.
Japanese bonds and the yen have come under pressure since Takaichi’s election as she pushes for expansionary fiscal policies
raising concerns about Japan’s fiscal outlook on fears of debt-funded spending.
The yen had rallied as much as 4.5% in late January on speculation of a US-Japan joint currency intervention
